docs.lead_paragraph: Government-subsidized health insurance - one of many perks of serving in Congress - kicked in on Tuesday for new members.

headline.main: Health Insurance Kicks In for Congress

docs.abstract: Federally sponsored health insurance kicked in for members of Congress, but some Republicans have decided not to enroll.
docs.snippet: Federally sponsored health insurance kicked in for members of Congress, but some Republicans have decided not to enroll.

docs.lead_paragraph: A recently released survey from the Employee Benefit Research Institute, a nonprofit group, examined the link between health savings accounts and other health reimbursement arrangements and cost-conscious behaviors among the people who use them.

headline.main: Do Health Savings Accounts Make for Savvy Patients?

docs.abstract: A recently released survey examined the link between health savings accounts and cost-conscious behaviors.
docs.snippet: A recently released survey examined the link between health savings accounts and cost-conscious behaviors.

docs.lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.

headline.main: Tuesday Reading: Less Expensive Concierge Care

docs.abstract: A medical practice offering more affordable concierge care, financial aid office scholarship advice and other consumer-focused items from Tuesday's Times.
docs.snippet: A medical practice offering more affordable concierge care, financial aid office scholarship advice and other consumer-focused items from Tuesday's Times.

docs.lead_paragraph: Four in five Internet users have searched the Web for health care information, most often checking on specific diseases and treatments, a Pew Internet Project survey reported on Tuesday.

headline.main: Health Care Is High Among Web Searches

docs.abstract: The latest Pew study shows many people are trying to learn about medical diseases that involve pain.
docs.snippet: The latest Pew study shows many people are trying to learn about medical diseases that involve pain.

docs.abstract: With four rulings on the health care law handed down, judges are split, 2-2. And in former President George W. Bush's family, one daughter is speaking out in favor of gay marriage, which her father opposed.
docs.snippet: With four rulings on the health care law handed down, judges are split, 2-2. And in former President George W. Bush's family, one daughter is speaking out in favor of gay marriage, which her father opposed.

docs.lead_paragraph: At One Medical Group, which charges a fee of $150 to $200 a year, same-day appointments are routine, doctors welcome e-mail communication and see at most 16 patients a day.

headline.seo: A Concierge Medical Practice Without the Concierge Fee
headline.main: Concierge Medical Care With a Smaller Price Tag
headline.print_headline: Concierge Medical Care With a Smaller Price Tag

docs.snippet: At One Medical Group, which charges a fee of $150 to $200 a year, same-day appointments are routine, doctors welcome e-mail communication and see at most 16 patients a day.

docs.lead_paragraph: As international business travel begins to rebound, fliers’ to-do lists get longer, including international cellphone coverage, credit card notifications and security.

headline.seo: Business Travelers’ Tricks to Avoid Trouble Abroad
headline.main: A Passport Is the Easy Part

docs.lead_paragraph: A judge said the insurance mandate in the health law made it unconstitutional, going further than a judge in Virginia had.

headline.seo: Ruling Against Health Care Law Evens Scorecard at 2-to-2
headline.main: Federal Judge Rules That Health Law Violates Constitution
headline.print_headline: Second Judge Deals Blow to Health Care Law

docs.snippet: A judge said the insurance mandate in the health law made it unconstitutional, going further than a judge in Virginia had.

docs.lead_paragraph: Physicians used to be the pillars of any community, but now doctors have become like everybody else: insecure, discontented and anxious about the future.

headline.seo: How the Knights in White Coats Lost Their Way
headline.main: Out of Camelot, Knights in White Coats Lose Way
headline.print_headline: Out of Camelot, Knights in White Coats Lose Way

docs.snippet: Physicians used to be the pillars of any community, but now doctors have become like everybody else: insecure, discontented and anxious about the future.

docs.lead_paragraph: Black and Hispanic women are tested at significantly higher rates than white women, a finding that could help explain why minority women have higher reported rates of the disease.

headline.seo: Chlamydia Screening More Common for Black and Hispanic Women
headline.main: Disparities: Racial Gaps Seen in Chlamydia Screening
headline.print_headline: DISPARITIES: Racial Gaps Seen in Chlamydia Screening

docs.snippet: Black and Hispanic women are tested at significantly higher rates than white women, a finding that could help explain why minority women have higher reported rates of the disease.
